description: From Middle English boldely, boldeliche, baldeliche, from Old English bealdlīċe (“boldly, earnestly”), equivalent to bold +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: boldly (comparative boldlier or more boldly, superlative boldliest or most boldly)

entries.meaning: In a bold manner; with confidence.
examples: To boldly go where no man has gone before.
